00015 /* ******************* */

00017 /* ******************* */
00018 var SWFUpload;
00019 
00020 if (SWFUpload == undefined) {
00021       SWFUpload = function (settings) {
00022             this.initSWFUpload(settings);
00023       };
00024 }
00025 
00026 SWFUpload.prototype.initSWFUpload = function (settings) {
00027       try {
00028             this.customSettings = {};     // A container where developers can place their own settings associated with this instance.
00029             this.settings = settings;
00030             this.eventQueue = [];
00031             this.movieName = "SWFUpload_" + SWFUpload.movieCount++;
00032             this.movieElement = null;
00033 
00034 
00035             // Setup global control tracking
00036             SWFUpload.instances[this.movieName] = this;
00037 
00038             // Load the settings.  Load the Flash movie.
00039             this.initSettings();
00040             this.loadFlash();
00041             this.displayDebugInfo();
00042       } catch (ex) {
00043             delete SWFUpload.instances[this.movieName];
00044             throw ex;
00045       }
00046 };

00094 // Private: takes a URL, determines if it is relative and converts to an absolute URL
00095 // using the current site. Only processes the URL if it can, otherwise returns the URL untouched
00096 SWFUpload.completeURL = function(url) {
00097       if (typeof(url) !== "string" || url.match(/^https?:\/\//i) || url.match(/^\//)) {
00098             return url;
00099       }
00100       
00101       var currentURL = window.location.protocol + "//" + window.location.hostname + (window.location.port ? ":" + window.location.port : "");
00102       
00103       var indexSlash = window.location.pathname.lastIndexOf("/");
00104       if (indexSlash <= 0) {
00105             path = "/";
00106       } else {
00107             path = window.location.pathname.substr(0, indexSlash) + "/";
00108       }
00109       
00110       return /*currentURL +*/ path + url;
00111       
00112 };

00119 // Private: initSettings ensures that all the
00120 // settings are set, getting a default value if one was not assigned.
00121 SWFUpload.prototype.initSettings = function () {
00122       this.ensureDefault = function (settingName, defaultValue) {
00123             this.settings[settingName] = (this.settings[settingName] == undefined) ? defaultValue : this.settings[settingName];
00124       };
00125       
00126       // Upload backend settings
00127       this.ensureDefault("upload_url", "");
00128       this.ensureDefault("preserve_relative_urls", false);
00129       this.ensureDefault("file_post_name", "Filedata");
00130       this.ensureDefault("post_params", {});
00131       this.ensureDefault("use_query_string", false);
00132       this.ensureDefault("requeue_on_error", false);
00133       this.ensureDefault("http_success", []);
00134       this.ensureDefault("assume_success_timeout", 0);
00135       
00136       // File Settings
00137       this.ensureDefault("file_types", "*.*");
00138       this.ensureDefault("file_types_description", "All Files");
00139       this.ensureDefault("file_size_limit", 0); // Default zero means "unlimited"
00140       this.ensureDefault("file_upload_limit", 0);
00141       this.ensureDefault("file_queue_limit", 0);
00142 
00143       // Flash Settings
00144       this.ensureDefault("flash_url", "swfupload.swf");
00145       this.ensureDefault("prevent_swf_caching", true);
00146       
00147       // Button Settings
00148       this.ensureDefault("button_image_url", "");
00149       this.ensureDefault("button_width", 1);
00150       this.ensureDefault("button_height", 1);
00151       this.ensureDefault("button_text", "");
00152       this.ensureDefault("button_text_style", "color: #000000; font-size: 16pt;");
00153       this.ensureDefault("button_text_top_padding", 0);
00154       this.ensureDefault("button_text_left_padding", 0);
00155       this.ensureDefault("button_action", SWFUpload.BUTTON_ACTION.SELECT_FILES);
00156       this.ensureDefault("button_disabled", false);
00157       this.ensureDefault("button_placeholder_id", "");
00158       this.ensureDefault("button_placeholder", null);
00159       this.ensureDefault("button_cursor", SWFUpload.CURSOR.ARROW);
00160       this.ensureDefault("button_window_mode", SWFUpload.WINDOW_MODE.WINDOW);
00161       
00162       // Debug Settings
00163       this.ensureDefault("debug", false);
00164       this.settings.debug_enabled = this.settings.debug;    // Here to maintain v2 API
00165       
00166       // Event Handlers
00167       this.settings.return_upload_start_handler = this.returnUploadStart;
00168       this.ensureDefault("swfupload_loaded_handler", null);
00169       this.ensureDefault("file_dialog_start_handler", null);
00170       this.ensureDefault("file_queued_handler", null);
00171       this.ensureDefault("file_queue_error_handler", null);
00172       this.ensureDefault("file_dialog_complete_handler", null);
00173       
00174       this.ensureDefault("upload_start_handler", null);
00175       this.ensureDefault("upload_progress_handler", null);
00176       this.ensureDefault("upload_error_handler", null);
00177       this.ensureDefault("upload_success_handler", null);
00178       this.ensureDefault("upload_complete_handler", null);
00179       
00180       this.ensureDefault("debug_handler", this.debugMessage);
00181 
00182       this.ensureDefault("custom_settings", {});
00183 
00184       // Other settings
00185       this.customSettings = this.settings.custom_settings;
00186       
00187       // Update the flash url if needed
00188       if (!!this.settings.prevent_swf_caching) {
00189             this.settings.flash_url = this.settings.flash_url + (this.settings.flash_url.indexOf("?") < 0 ? "?" : "&") + "preventswfcaching=" + new Date().getTime();
00190       }
00191       
00192       if (!this.settings.preserve_relative_urls) {
00193             //this.settings.flash_url = SWFUpload.completeURL(this.settings.flash_url);   // Don't need to do this one since flash doesn't look at it
00194             this.settings.upload_url = SWFUpload.completeURL(this.settings.upload_url);
00195             this.settings.button_image_url = SWFUpload.completeURL(this.settings.button_image_url);
00196       }
00197       
00198       delete this.ensureDefault;
00199 };
00200 
00201 // Private: loadFlash replaces the button_placeholder element with the flash movie.
00202 SWFUpload.prototype.loadFlash = function () {
00203       var targetElement, tempParent;
00204 
00205       // Make sure an element with the ID we are going to use doesn't already exist
00206       if (document.getElementById(this.movieName) !== null) {
00207             throw "ID " + this.movieName + " is already in use. The Flash Object could not be added";
00208       }
00209 
00210       // Get the element where we will be placing the flash movie
00211       targetElement = document.getElementById(this.settings.button_placeholder_id) || this.settings.button_placeholder;
00212 
00213       if (targetElement == undefined) {
00214             throw "Could not find the placeholder element: " + this.settings.button_placeholder_id;
00215       }
00216 
00217       // Append the container and load the flash
00218       tempParent = document.createElement("div");
00219       tempParent.innerHTML = this.getFlashHTML();     // Using innerHTML is non-standard but the only sensible way to dynamically add Flash in IE (and maybe other browsers)
00220       targetElement.parentNode.replaceChild(tempParent.firstChild, targetElement);
00221 
00222       // Fix IE Flash/Form bug
00223       if (window[this.movieName] == undefined) {
00224             window[this.movieName] = this.getMovieElement();
00225       }
00226       
00227 };
00228 
00229 // Private: getFlashHTML generates the object tag needed to embed the flash in to the document
00230 SWFUpload.prototype.getFlashHTML = function () {
00231       // Flash Satay object syntax: http://www.alistapart.com/articles/flashsatay
00232       return ['<object id="', this.movieName, '" type="application/x-shockwave-flash" data="', this.settings.flash_url, '" width="', this.settings.button_width, '" height="', this.settings.button_height, '" class="swfupload">',
00233                         '<param name="wmode" value="', this.settings.button_window_mode, '" />',
00234                         '<param name="movie" value="', this.settings.flash_url, '" />',
00235                         '<param name="quality" value="high" />',
00236                         '<param name="menu" value="false" />',
00237                         '<param name="allowScriptAccess" value="always" />',
00238                         '<param name="flashvars" value="' + this.getFlashVars() + '" />',
00239                         '</object>'].join("");
00240 };
00241 
00242 // Private: getFlashVars builds the parameter string that will be passed
00243 // to flash in the flashvars param.
00244 SWFUpload.prototype.getFlashVars = function () {
00245       // Build a string from the post param object
00246       var paramString = this.buildParamString();
00247       var httpSuccessString = this.settings.http_success.join(",");
00248       
00249       // Build the parameter string
00250       return ["movieName=", encodeURIComponent(this.movieName),
00251                   "&amp;uploadURL=", encodeURIComponent(this.settings.upload_url),
00252                   "&amp;useQueryString=", encodeURIComponent(this.settings.use_query_string),
00253                   "&amp;requeueOnError=", encodeURIComponent(this.settings.requeue_on_error),
00254                   "&amp;httpSuccess=", encodeURIComponent(httpSuccessString),
00255                   "&amp;assumeSuccessTimeout=", encodeURIComponent(this.settings.assume_success_timeout),
00256                   "&amp;params=", encodeURIComponent(paramString),
00257                   "&amp;filePostName=", encodeURIComponent(this.settings.file_post_name),
00258                   "&amp;fileTypes=", encodeURIComponent(this.settings.file_types),
00259                   "&amp;fileTypesDescription=", encodeURIComponent(this.settings.file_types_description),
00260                   "&amp;fileSizeLimit=", encodeURIComponent(this.settings.file_size_limit),
00261                   "&amp;fileUploadLimit=", encodeURIComponent(this.settings.file_upload_limit),
00262                   "&amp;fileQueueLimit=", encodeURIComponent(this.settings.file_queue_limit),
00263                   "&amp;debugEnabled=", encodeURIComponent(this.settings.debug_enabled),
00264                   "&amp;buttonImageURL=", encodeURIComponent(this.settings.button_image_url),
00265                   "&amp;buttonWidth=", encodeURIComponent(this.settings.button_width),
00266                   "&amp;buttonHeight=", encodeURIComponent(this.settings.button_height),
00267                   "&amp;buttonText=", encodeURIComponent(this.settings.button_text),
00268                   "&amp;buttonTextTopPadding=", encodeURIComponent(this.settings.button_text_top_padding),
00269                   "&amp;buttonTextLeftPadding=", encodeURIComponent(this.settings.button_text_left_padding),
00270                   "&amp;buttonTextStyle=", encodeURIComponent(this.settings.button_text_style),
00271                   "&amp;buttonAction=", encodeURIComponent(this.settings.button_action),
00272                   "&amp;buttonDisabled=", encodeURIComponent(this.settings.button_disabled),
00273                   "&amp;buttonCursor=", encodeURIComponent(this.settings.button_cursor)
00274             ].join("");
00275 };
00276 
00277 // Public: getMovieElement retrieves the DOM reference to the Flash element added by SWFUpload
00278 // The element is cached after the first lookup
00279 SWFUpload.prototype.getMovieElement = function () {
00280       if (this.movieElement == undefined) {
00281             this.movieElement = document.getElementById(this.movieName);
00282       }
00283 
00284       if (this.movieElement === null) {
00285             throw "Could not find Flash element";
00286       }
00287       
00288       return this.movieElement;
00289 };
00290 
00291 // Private: buildParamString takes the name/value pairs in the post_params setting object
00292 // and joins them up in to a string formatted "name=value&amp;name=value"
00293 SWFUpload.prototype.buildParamString = function () {
00294       var postParams = this.settings.post_params; 
00295       var paramStringPairs = [];
00296 
00297       if (typeof(postParams) === "object") {
00298             for (var name in postParams) {
00299                   if (postParams.hasOwnProperty(name)) {
00300                         paramStringPairs.push(encodeURIComponent(name.toString()) + "=" + encodeURIComponent(postParams[name].toString()));
00301                   }
00302             }
00303       }
00304 
00305       return paramStringPairs.join("&amp;");
00306 };
00307 
00308 // Public: Used to remove a SWFUpload instance from the page. This method strives to remove
00309 // all references to the SWF, and other objects so memory is properly freed.
00310 // Returns true if everything was destroyed. Returns a false if a failure occurs leaving SWFUpload in an inconsistant state.
00311 // Credits: Major improvements provided by steffen
00312 SWFUpload.prototype.destroy = function () {
00313       try {
00314             // Make sure Flash is done before we try to remove it
00315             this.cancelUpload(null, false);
00316             
00317 
00318             // Remove the SWFUpload DOM nodes
00319             var movieElement = null;
00320             movieElement = this.getMovieElement();
00321             
00322             if (movieElement && typeof(movieElement.CallFunction) === "unknown") { // We only want to do this in IE
00323                   // Loop through all the movie's properties and remove all function references (DOM/JS IE 6/7 memory leak workaround)
00324                   for (var i in movieElement) {
00325                         try {
00326                               if (typeof(movieElement[i]) === "function") {
00327                                     movieElement[i] = null;
00328                               }
00329                         } catch (ex1) {}
00330                   }
00331 
00332                   // Remove the Movie Element from the page
00333                   try {
00334                         movieElement.parentNode.removeChild(movieElement);
00335                   } catch (ex) {}
00336             }
00337             
00338             // Remove IE form fix reference
00339             window[this.movieName] = null;
00340 
00341             // Destroy other references
00342             SWFUpload.instances[this.movieName] = null;
00343             delete SWFUpload.instances[this.movieName];
00344 
00345             this.movieElement = null;
00346             this.settings = null;
00347             this.customSettings = null;
00348             this.eventQueue = null;
00349             this.movieName = null;
00350             
00351             
00352             return true;
00353       } catch (ex2) {
00354             return false;
00355       }
00356 };

00359 // Public: displayDebugInfo prints out settings and configuration
00360 // information about this SWFUpload instance.
00361 // This function (and any references to it) can be deleted when placing
00362 // SWFUpload in production.

00364       this.debug(
00365             [

00369                   "Settings:\n",
00370                   "\t", "upload_url:               ", this.settings.upload_url, "\n",
00371                   "\t", "flash_url:                ", this.settings.flash_url, "\n",
00372                   "\t", "use_query_string:         ", this.settings.use_query_string.toString(), "\n",
00373                   "\t", "requeue_on_error:         ", this.settings.requeue_on_error.toString(), "\n",
00374                   "\t", "http_success:             ", this.settings.http_success.join(", "), "\n",
00375                   "\t", "assume_success_timeout:   ", this.settings.assume_success_timeout, "\n",
00376                   "\t", "file_post_name:           ", this.settings.file_post_name, "\n",
00377                   "\t", "post_params:              ", this.settings.post_params.toString(), "\n",
00378                   "\t", "file_types:               ", this.settings.file_types, "\n",
00379                   "\t", "file_types_description:   ", this.settings.file_types_description, "\n",
00380                   "\t", "file_size_limit:          ", this.settings.file_size_limit, "\n",
00381                   "\t", "file_upload_limit:        ", this.settings.file_upload_limit, "\n",
00382                   "\t", "file_queue_limit:         ", this.settings.file_queue_limit, "\n",
00383                   "\t", "debug:                    ", this.settings.debug.toString(), "\n",
00384 
00385                   "\t", "prevent_swf_caching:      ", this.settings.prevent_swf_caching.toString(), "\n",
00386 
00387                   "\t", "button_placeholder_id:    ", this.settings.button_placeholder_id.toString(), "\n",
00388                   "\t", "button_placeholder:       ", (this.settings.button_placeholder ? "Set" : "Not Set"), "\n",
00389                   "\t", "button_image_url:         ", this.settings.button_image_url.toString(), "\n",
00390                   "\t", "button_width:             ", this.settings.button_width.toString(), "\n",
00391                   "\t", "button_height:            ", this.settings.button_height.toString(), "\n",
00392                   "\t", "button_text:              ", this.settings.button_text.toString(), "\n",
00393                   "\t", "button_text_style:        ", this.settings.button_text_style.toString(), "\n",
00394                   "\t", "button_text_top_padding:  ", this.settings.button_text_top_padding.toString(), "\n",
00395                   "\t", "button_text_left_padding: ", this.settings.button_text_left_padding.toString(), "\n",
00396                   "\t", "button_action:            ", this.settings.button_action.toString(), "\n",
00397                   "\t", "button_disabled:          ", this.settings.button_disabled.toString(), "\n",
00398 
00399                   "\t", "custom_settings:          ", this.settings.custom_settings.toString(), "\n",
00400                   "Event Handlers:\n",
00401                   "\t", "swfupload_loaded_handler assigned:  ", (typeof this.settings.swfupload_loaded_handler === "function").toString(), "\n",
00402                   "\t", "file_dialog_start_handler assigned: ", (typeof this.settings.file_dialog_start_handler === "function").toString(), "\n",
00403                   "\t", "file_queued_handler assigned:       ", (typeof this.settings.file_queued_handler === "function").toString(), "\n",

00405                   "\t", "upload_start_handler assigned:      ", (typeof this.settings.upload_start_handler === "function").toString(), "\n",
00406                   "\t", "upload_progress_handler assigned:   ", (typeof this.settings.upload_progress_handler === "function").toString(), "\n",
00407                   "\t", "upload_error_handler assigned:      ", (typeof this.settings.upload_error_handler === "function").toString(), "\n",
00408                   "\t", "upload_success_handler assigned:    ", (typeof this.settings.upload_success_handler === "function").toString(), "\n",
00409                   "\t", "upload_complete_handler assigned:   ", (typeof this.settings.upload_complete_handler === "function").toString(), "\n",

00411             ].join("")

00415 /* Note: addSetting and getSetting are no longer used by SWFUpload but are included
00416       the maintain v2 API compatibility
00417 */
00418 // Public: (Deprecated) addSetting adds a setting value. If the value given is undefined or null then the default_value is used.
00419 SWFUpload.prototype.addSetting = function (name, value, default_value) {
00420     if (value == undefined) {
00421         return (this.settings[name] = default_value);
00422     } else {
00423         return (this.settings[name] = value);
00424       }
00425 };
00426 
00427 // Public: (Deprecated) getSetting gets a setting. Returns an empty string if the setting was not found.
00428 SWFUpload.prototype.getSetting = function (name) {
00429     if (this.settings[name] != undefined) {
00430         return this.settings[name];
00431       }
00432 
00433     return "";
00434 };

00438 // Private: callFlash handles function calls made to the Flash element.
00439 // Calls are made with a setTimeout for some functions to work around
00440 // bugs in the ExternalInterface library.
00441 SWFUpload.prototype.callFlash = function (functionName, argumentArray) {
00442       argumentArray = argumentArray || [];
00443       
00444       var movieElement = this.getMovieElement();
00445       var returnValue, returnString;
00446 
00447       // Flash's method if calling ExternalInterface methods (code adapted from MooTools).
00448       try {
00449             returnString = movieElement.CallFunction('<invoke name="' + functionName + '" returntype="javascript">' + __flash__argumentsToXML(argumentArray, 0) + '</invoke>');
00450             returnValue = eval(returnString);
00451       } catch (ex) {
00452             throw "Call to " + functionName + " failed";
00453       }
00454       
00455       // Unescape file post param values
00456       if (returnValue != undefined && typeof returnValue.post === "object") {
00457             returnValue = this.unescapeFilePostParams(returnValue);
00458       }
00459 
00460       return returnValue;
00461 };

00463 /* *****************************
00464       -- Flash control methods --
00465       Your UI should use these
00466       to operate SWFUpload
00467    ***************************** */
00468 
00469 // WARNING: this function does not work in Flash Player 10
00470 // Public: selectFile causes a File Selection Dialog window to appear.  This
00471 // dialog only allows 1 file to be selected.
00472 SWFUpload.prototype.selectFile = function () {
00473       this.callFlash("SelectFile");
00474 };
00475 
00476 // WARNING: this function does not work in Flash Player 10
00477 // Public: selectFiles causes a File Selection Dialog window to appear/ This
00478 // dialog allows the user to select any number of files
00479 // Flash Bug Warning: Flash limits the number of selectable files based on the combined length of the file names.
00480 // If the selection name length is too long the dialog will fail in an unpredictable manner.  There is no work-around
00481 // for this bug.
00482 SWFUpload.prototype.selectFiles = function () {
00483       this.callFlash("SelectFiles");
00484 };

00486 
00487 // Public: startUpload starts uploading the first file in the queue unless
00488 // the optional parameter 'fileID' specifies the ID 
00489 SWFUpload.prototype.startUpload = function (fileID) {
00490       this.callFlash("StartUpload", [fileID]);
00491 };
00492 
00493 // Public: cancelUpload cancels any queued file.  The fileID parameter may be the file ID or index.
00494 // If you do not specify a fileID the current uploading file or first file in the queue is cancelled.
00495 // If you do not want the uploadError event to trigger you can specify false for the triggerErrorEvent parameter.
00496 SWFUpload.prototype.cancelUpload = function (fileID, triggerErrorEvent) {
00497       if (triggerErrorEvent !== false) {
00498             triggerErrorEvent = true;
00499       }
00500       this.callFlash("CancelUpload", [fileID, triggerErrorEvent]);
00501 };
00502 
00503 // Public: stopUpload stops the current upload and requeues the file at the beginning of the queue.
00504 // If nothing is currently uploading then nothing happens.
00505 SWFUpload.prototype.stopUpload = function () {
00506       this.callFlash("StopUpload");
00507 };

00509 /* ************************
00510  * Settings methods
00511  *   These methods change the SWFUpload settings.
00512  *   SWFUpload settings should not be changed directly on the settings object
00513  *   since many of the settings need to be passed to Flash in order to take
00514  *   effect.
00515  * *********************** */
00516 
00517 // Public: getStats gets the file statistics object.
00518 SWFUpload.prototype.getStats = function () {
00519       return this.callFlash("GetStats");
00520 };
00521 
00522 // Public: setStats changes the SWFUpload statistics.  You shouldn't need to 
00523 // change the statistics but you can.  Changing the statistics does not
00524 // affect SWFUpload accept for the successful_uploads count which is used
00525 // by the upload_limit setting to determine how many files the user may upload.
00526 SWFUpload.prototype.setStats = function (statsObject) {
00527       this.callFlash("SetStats", [statsObject]);
00528 };
00529 
00530 // Public: getFile retrieves a File object by ID or Index.  If the file is
00531 // not found then 'null' is returned.
00532 SWFUpload.prototype.getFile = function (fileID) {
00533       if (typeof(fileID) === "number") {
00534             return this.callFlash("GetFileByIndex", [fileID]);
00535       } else {
00536             return this.callFlash("GetFile", [fileID]);
00537       }
00538 };

00699 /* *******************************
00700       Flash Event Interfaces
00701       These functions are used by Flash to trigger the various
00702       events.
00703       
00704       All these functions a Private.
00705       
00706       Because the ExternalInterface library is buggy the event calls
00707       are added to a queue and the queue then executed by a setTimeout.
00708       This ensures that events are executed in a determinate order and that
00709       the ExternalInterface bugs are avoided.
00710 ******************************* */
00711 
00712 SWFUpload.prototype.queueEvent = function (handlerName, argumentArray) {
00713       // Warning: Don't call this.debug inside here or you'll create an infinite loop
00714       
00715       if (argumentArray == undefined) {
00716             argumentArray = [];
00717       } else if (!(argumentArray instanceof Array)) {
00718             argumentArray = [argumentArray];
00719       }
00720       
00721       var self = this;
00722       if (typeof this.settings[handlerName] === "function") {
00723             // Queue the event
00724             this.eventQueue.push(function () {
00725                   this.settings[handlerName].apply(this, argumentArray);
00726             });
00727             
00728             // Execute the next queued event
00729             setTimeout(function () {
00730                   self.executeNextEvent();
00731             }, 0);
00732             
00733       } else if (this.settings[handlerName] !== null) {
00734             throw "Event handler " + handlerName + " is unknown or is not a function";
00735       }
00736 };
00737 
00738 // Private: Causes the next event in the queue to be executed.  Since events are queued using a setTimeout
00739 // we must queue them in order to garentee that they are executed in order.
00740 SWFUpload.prototype.executeNextEvent = function () {
00741       // Warning: Don't call this.debug inside here or you'll create an infinite loop
00742 
00743       var  f = this.eventQueue ? this.eventQueue.shift() : null;
00744       if (typeof(f) === "function") {
00745             f.apply(this);
00746       }
00747 };
00748 
00749 // Private: unescapeFileParams is part of a workaround for a flash bug where objects passed through ExternalInterface cannot have
00750 // properties that contain characters that are not valid for JavaScript identifiers. To work around this
00751 // the Flash Component escapes the parameter names and we must unescape again before passing them along.
00752 SWFUpload.prototype.unescapeFilePostParams = function (file) {
00753       var reg = /[$]([0-9a-f]{4})/i;
00754       var unescapedPost = {};
00755       var uk;
00756 
00757       if (file != undefined) {
00758             for (var k in file.post) {
00759                   if (file.post.hasOwnProperty(k)) {
00760                         uk = k;
00761                         var match;
00762                         while ((match = reg.exec(uk)) !== null) {
00763                               uk = uk.replace(match[0], String.fromCharCode(parseInt("0x" + match[1], 16)));
00764                         }
00765                         unescapedPost[uk] = file.post[k];
00766                   }
00767             }
00768 
00769             file.post = unescapedPost;
00770       }
00771 
00772       return file;
00773 };
00774 
00775 // Private: Called by Flash to see if JS can call in to Flash (test if External Interface is working)
00776 SWFUpload.prototype.testExternalInterface = function () {
00777       try {
00778             return this.callFlash("TestExternalInterface");
00779       } catch (ex) {
00780             return false;
00781       }
00782 };
00783 
00784 // Private: This event is called by Flash when it has finished loading. Don't modify this.
00785 // Use the swfupload_loaded_handler event setting to execute custom code when SWFUpload has loaded.
00786 SWFUpload.prototype.flashReady = function () {
00787       // Check that the movie element is loaded correctly with its ExternalInterface methods defined
00788       var movieElement = this.getMovieElement();
00789 
00790       if (!movieElement) {
00791             this.debug("Flash called back ready but the flash movie can't be found.");
00792             return;
00793       }
00794 
00795       this.cleanUp(movieElement);
00796       
00797       this.queueEvent("swfupload_loaded_handler");
00798 };
00799 
00800 // Private: removes Flash added fuctions to the DOM node to prevent memory leaks in IE.
00801 // This function is called by Flash each time the ExternalInterface functions are created.
00802 SWFUpload.prototype.cleanUp = function (movieElement) {
00803       // Pro-actively unhook all the Flash functions
00804       try {
00805             if (this.movieElement && typeof(movieElement.CallFunction) === "unknown") { // We only want to do this in IE
00806                   this.debug("Removing Flash functions hooks (this should only run in IE and should prevent memory leaks)");
00807                   for (var key in movieElement) {
00808                         try {
00809                               if (typeof(movieElement[key]) === "function") {
00810                                     movieElement[key] = null;
00811                               }
00812                         } catch (ex) {
00813                         }
00814                   }
00815             }
00816       } catch (ex1) {
00817       
00818       }
00819 
00820       // Fix Flashes own cleanup code so if the SWFMovie was removed from the page
00821       // it doesn't display errors.
00822       window["__flash__removeCallback"] = function (instance, name) {
00823             try {
00824                   if (instance) {
00825                         instance[name] = null;
00826                   }
00827             } catch (flashEx) {
00828             
00829             }
00830       };
00831 
00832 };

00860 SWFUpload.prototype.uploadStart = function (file) {
00861       file = this.unescapeFilePostParams(file);
00862       this.queueEvent("return_upload_start_handler", file);
00863 };
00864 
00865 SWFUpload.prototype.returnUploadStart = function (file) {
00866       var returnValue;
00867       if (typeof this.settings.upload_start_handler === "function") {
00868             file = this.unescapeFilePostParams(file);
00869             returnValue = this.settings.upload_start_handler.call(this, file);
00870       } else if (this.settings.upload_start_handler != undefined) {
00871             throw "upload_start_handler must be a function";
00872       }
00873 
00874       // Convert undefined to true so if nothing is returned from the upload_start_handler it is
00875       // interpretted as 'true'.
00876       if (returnValue === undefined) {
00877             returnValue = true;
00878       }
00879       
00880       returnValue = !!returnValue;
00881       
00882       this.callFlash("ReturnUploadStart", [returnValue]);
00883 };

00890 };

00907 /* Called by SWFUpload JavaScript and Flash functions when debug is enabled. By default it writes messages to the
00908    internal debug console.  You can override this event and have messages written where you want. */
00909 SWFUpload.prototype.debug = function (message) {
00910       this.queueEvent("debug_handler", message);
00911 };
00912 
00913 
00914 /* **********************************
00915       Debug Console
00916       The debug console is a self contained, in page location
00917       for debug message to be sent.  The Debug Console adds
00918       itself to the body if necessary.
00919 
00920       The console is automatically scrolled as messages appear.
00921       
00922       If you are using your own debug handler or when you deploy to production and
00923       have debug disabled you can remove these functions to reduce the file size
00924       and complexity.
00925 ********************************** */
00926    
00927 // Private: debugMessage is the default debug_handler.  If you want to print debug messages
00928 // call the debug() function.  When overriding the function your own function should
00929 // check to see if the debug setting is true before outputting debug information.
00930 SWFUpload.prototype.debugMessage = function (message) {
00931       if (this.settings.debug) {
00932             var exceptionMessage, exceptionValues = [];
00933 
00934             // Check for an exception object and print it nicely
00935             if (typeof message === "object" && typeof message.name === "string" && typeof message.message === "string") {
00936                   for (var key in message) {
00937                         if (message.hasOwnProperty(key)) {
00938                               exceptionValues.push(key + ": " + message[key]);
00939                         }
00940                   }
00941                   exceptionMessage = exceptionValues.join("\n") || "";
00942                   exceptionValues = exceptionMessage.split("\n");
00943                   exceptionMessage = "EXCEPTION: " + exceptionValues.join("\nEXCEPTION: ");
00944                   SWFUpload.Console.writeLine(exceptionMessage);
00945             } else {
00946                   SWFUpload.Console.writeLine(message);
00947             }
00948       }
00949 };
00950 
00951 SWFUpload.Console = {};
00952 SWFUpload.Console.writeLine = function (message) {
00953       var console, documentForm;
00954 
00955       try {
00956             console = document.getElementById("SWFUpload_Console");
00957 
00958             if (!console) {
00959                   documentForm = document.createElement("form");
00960                   document.getElementsByTagName("body")[0].appendChild(documentForm);
00961 
00962                   console = document.createElement("textarea");
00963                   console.id = "SWFUpload_Console";
00964                   console.style.fontFamily = "monospace";
00965                   console.setAttribute("wrap", "off");
00966                   console.wrap = "off";
00967                   console.style.overflow = "auto";
00968                   console.style.width = "700px";
00969                   console.style.height = "350px";
00970                   console.style.margin = "5px";
00971                   documentForm.appendChild(console);
00972             }
00973 
00974             console.value += message + "\n";
00975 
00976             console.scrollTop = console.scrollHeight - console.clientHeight;
00977       } catch (ex) {
00978             alert("Exception: " + ex.name + " Message: " + ex.message);
00979       }
00980 };
